alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend; Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 7:50PM CDT until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Cypress Creek Near Sharp Road affecting Fort Bend and Harris Counties. San Bernard River near Sweeny affecting Brazoria County. San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Colorado, Fort Bend, Austin and Wharton Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River near Boling affecting Brazoria, Fort Bend and Wharton Counties. For the Cypress Creek...including Eldridge Parkway, Mathis Road, Sharp Road, Katy-Hockley Road, Hufmeister Road, Grant Road, Kohrville, Stuebner-Airline Road, Westfield, Kuykendahl Road, Cypresswood Drive, Inverness Forest...Minor flooding is forecast. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cypress Creek Near Sharp Road. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 164.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM CDT Thursday was 165.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 165.0 feet this evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 164.2 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 164.9 feet on 06/09/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (unknown time) Location Stg Stg Day/Time d1 d2 d3 Cypress Creek Sharp Road 164.2 164.2 Thu 7 pm CDT MSG MSG MSG &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 100 PM CDT.
